main event: On September 6, 1957, an object was sighted on radar in Washington, D.C.
interesting points: The object was the size of a lamp and moved north for five minutes on radar., The object was possibly identified as a balloon or astronomical phenomenon., Observers described the object as having a bright white light and traveling at high speed., Witnesses noted the object disappeared from sight to the south shortly after being observed., Weather conditions at the time were mostly fair with winds predominantly from the south.
witness description: redacted information about the observers from the area
